metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27066 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In xfrm6_tunnel_free_spi of net/ipv6/xfrm6_tunnel.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-168043318

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.118').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.65').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.78').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.142').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
